definition: public transportation/mass transit/abbr. for 公共交通[gong1 gong4 jiao1 tong1]

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: But there’s a money factor for most transit systems.
sentences.chinese: 但是，大多数公交系统都有资金的问题。

sentences.english: Does this bus go to Silk Street?
sentences.chinese: 这辆公交车经过秀水街吗？

sentences.english: Many buses are installed automatic bus-stop broadcasting systems.
sentences.chinese: 目前，许多公交车辆都安装了自动报站系统。

sentences.english: The bus was so packed and I got totally squished this morning.
sentences.chinese: 公交车挤满了人，我今天早上几乎被压扁了。
肯当时还引进了身长18米的铰接式公交车。

sentences.english: I think this is one of the bus IC card design negligence.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得，这是公交IC卡的一个设计上的疏忽。

sentences.english: Some buses in Beijing have a box near a box near the driver.
sentences.chinese: 北京的公交车在司机的附近有个盒子。

sentences.english: Before I got to the bus stop, the bus had already left.
sentences.chinese: 到了公交车站前，汽车已经开走了。

sentences.english: On the bus we should offer our seats to the old, and young.
sentences.chinese: 公交车上，我们要主动给老幼让座。

sentences.english: Turns out I paid the bus driver $200.
sentences.chinese: 卧槽我投了200刀给公交车么。

sentences.english: He can take the No. 57 bus.
I've got the stubs from the bus companies to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 至今，那些留下来的公交公司的票根足以为证。

sentences.english: Laurance- Is this where I catch the bus for the zoo?
sentences.chinese: 我能在这坐公交车去动物园吗？

sentences.english: Does he know where I can take a bus to the suburbs.
sentences.chinese: 他知道在哪里我可以坐公交车到郊外去吗？

sentences.english: The subways and buses were idle.
sentences.chinese: 地铁和公交都已经停运。

sentences.english: I have always been annoyed by the game's lack of proper bus lines.
sentences.chinese: 我一真都不喜欢这游戏没有公交线路。

definition: bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
light rail/transit system (underground, at street level or elevated)/streetcar/metro/abbr. for 輕型軌道交通|轻型轨道交通[qing1 xing2 gui3 dao4 jiao1 tong1]
bus information board/street sign for a bus stop/bus stop
to change train (plane, bus etc)/transfer between modes of transport
terminus/final stop on rail or bus line
